DOC.HEADLINE: Maria Hernandez wins top US college golf award

TEXT.P: Spain's Maria Hernandez earned the Honda Sports Award on Thursday as America's best female college golfer.

Hernandez was the most decorated golfer in Purdue University history. She won six tournaments this season, and birdied two of her final three holes to win the U.S. individual title. She had a low round of 67 and a 72.8 stroke average.
She helped Purdue win three Big Ten team championships and was selected as the school's first national player of the year.
Hernandez was eligible for the Honda-Broderick Cup for the top U.S. college women's athlete, to be announced on June 22.
